2. The SAMSUNG QN75QN90A



If you play games with a high dynamic range, the Samsung QN90A is a fantastic choice. Its reduced input lag and lightning-fast response time make it perfect for gaming.

Specification

● Size: About 75 inches in height

● Resolution: 4K • 3840 x 2160

● Observed aspect ratio: 16:9

Pros

+ We were able to see everything from a decent vantage point.

+ Superb HDR peak brightness.

+ Native contrast is superb.

+ Excellent Mini LED support for full-array local dimming.

Cons

− Fragile pedestal.

− There is no One Connect Box.

− Lacks Dolby Vision compatibility.

− Bad audio quality.


You won't be disappointed in the Samsung QN90A's sturdy construction. The TV itself, unlike the stand, is entirely plastic. However, the TV has a very robust and well-built feel. This textured plastic has a high-end feel. As expected of a premium product, there are no glaring flaws or missing components. The small and lightweight panel causes the TV to wobble on the stand, but this isn't a problem unless you move your set around frequently.

The Samsung QN90A QLED is an elite 4k LED TV that features Mini LED backlighting with a quantum dot layer to display a wide color gamut at various brightness settings. The TV's Mini LED backlighting allows for deeper blacks thanks to improved local dimming; it can also be dimmed down to a usable level and yet get quite bright, making it suitable for either reducing glare or bringing out highlights.

The new remote is solar-powered, and the Tizen innovative platform it runs on is user-friendly and includes various downloadable applications.One of the first displays to use Samsung's much-touted Neo QLED solar cells in 2021 is the QN90A Neo QLED, which boasts a higher ratio of emission photons diodes per square inch than previous generations. ● 4K Ultra High-Definition: Yes

Pros

+ A minimal delay between input and output.

+ A curved screen could improve the field of view.

+ Helps the chroma format of 4:4:4.

Cons
